projectPurpose: To create a modern, reliable, and performant embedded transactional database system that is highly compatible with SQLite but rewritten from scratch in Rust to offer advantages like memory safety, asynchronous I/O, better WASM support, and advanced testing techniques, serving as the "modern evolution of SQLite".
mainFeatures: Compatible with SQLite (SQL dialect, file formats, C API)

alternatives.name: Apache Derby
mainFeatures: Based on Java, JDBC, and SQL standards

alternatives.name: DuckDB
mainFeatures: Integrates with multiple languages (Python, R, Java, etc.)

marketPositioning: Limbo is positioned as a cutting-edge, embedded OLTP database engine, built in Rust with strong SQLite compatibility. It targets developers seeking a modern alternative that offers the memory safety of Rust, native asynchronous I/O capabilities for improved performance in certain scenarios, first-class support for WebAssembly environments, and enhanced reliability through advanced testing methodologies, differentiating itself from the established C-based SQLite and Java-based embedded databases.
